sense.name: place firmly, deposit
sense.examples: The child carefully posited the vase on the table. The professors will posit the bookshelves against the walls. The students posited their homework on the teacher's desk.

sense.name: state, put forth for consideration
sense.examples: I posit the accused is guilty. I posited that the teacher may not always be correct. I will posit an alternative to your theory. Ladies and gentlemen, allow me to posit an alternative scenario. The students posited murderers for the crime.

sense.name: postulate, presume
sense.examples: The scientists posit basic principles of gravity. The theory posits cooperation amongst participants. Teachers posit basic competence of their students. He posited three basic laws of nature. They will posit underlying structures.
